title: Mery Perello marries Rafa Nadal in two custom-made bridal gowns
text:
From Harper's BAZAAR

Tennis star Rafa Nadal married his long-term girlfriend Mery Perello this weekend, in a romantic al fresco ceremony in Mallorca.

The bride wore not one but two custom-made dresses to celebrate their nuptials, both by Spanish bridal designer Rosa Clara.

Her first look was a delicate lace gown with long sleeves and a belt that defined the waist.



Photo credit: Courtesy More

In a statement sent to Bazaar UK, the designer described the dress: “The bodice, with jewel neckline and long sleeves, was made of beautiful Art Deco-inspired French lace with delicate patterning, flower motifs and micro beading on the meticulously hand-embroidered fabric.”

“The ballgown-style skirt, made of silk crepe, featured a weightless detachable train, created in Rosa Clara’s Atelier.”

Perello later changed into her second dress for the evening celebrations, which featured a halter neck, an open back and had jewels all over.

Clara, who has been designing bridal wear for almost 25 years, described what a privilege it was to work with the bride: “I feel very fortunate to have met Mery and to have designed the wedding dress she had always dreamt of.

“Being part of this moment is thrilling and a little scary - the responsibility that comes with a wedding like this that receives so much international attention is enormous. The connection with Mery was immediate, as it was with her mother and Rafa’s mother and sister. They’re an extraordinary family and it has been a pleasure to work with them.”

Clara also created dresses for for Perello’s mother on the big day, as well as Nadal’s mother and sister. The wedding took place in La Fortaleza, a 17th century fortress in Mallorca, with historic grounds and beautiful sea views.
